channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump Says He Will Debate Harris
item.description: According to Mr. Trump’s post on social media, the debate will take place in Pennsylvania, a crucial battleground state.

item.title: Israel, Defiant, Appears to Have Gone Rogue, Risking a Regional War
item.description: Ignoring the efforts of President Biden and the condemnation of many allies, the Israeli prime minister is forcing the pace of the war and feeding the revolt of the far right.

item.title: Empty nesters are sad when their kids leave—and even more distressed when they return home
item.description: Why grown kids moving back home can be a big adjustment for parents.

item.title: Iran Arrests Dozens After Killing of Hamas Leader Haniyeh
item.description: Iran has begun a sweeping investigation into the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, with its intensity a sign of how damaging and shocking the security failure was.

item.title: Iran Arrests Dozens After Killing of Hamas Leader Haniyeh
item.description: Iran has begun a sweeping investigation into the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, with its intensity a sign of how damaging and shocking the security failure was.

item.title: Uber’s legal chief takes leave to support sister-in-law Kamala Harris’ presidential campaign
item.description: “While I love my job, my team, and the positive impact Uber has on the world, I have always believed family comes first,” Tony West wrote.

item.title: To Lam Confirmed as Vietnam’s Top Leader
item.description: Mr. Lam had been filling the post of general secretary temporarily since the death of his predecessor in July. Now he is in position to consolidate power.

item.title: Myanmar Junta Evades Sanctions and Increases Airstrikes
item.description: The military has stepped up a campaign of airstrikes, and killed more civilians, to fend off rebel advances.

item.title: Former CEO gets prison after plotting a $40 million payday
item.description: Jacksonville's city council auditor in 2019 uncovered a hidden incentive plan created by the exec.

item.title: Defense Secretary Revokes Plea Deal for Accused Sept. 11 Plotters
item.description: Defense Secretary Lloyd J. Austin III assumed direct oversight of the case and effectively put the death penalty back on the table.

item.title: Marcell Jacobs, Olympic 100-Meter Champion, Looks to Prove the Doubters Wrong
item.description: When the Italian sprinter came from nowhere to win 100-meter gold in Tokyo, whispers spread about his sudden rise. In Paris, he hopes to silence them for good.

item.title: UAW chief slams Donald Trump’s labor record
item.description: Kamala Harris can boost the Democrats' chances of winning swing-state Michigan.

item.title: Prisoner Deals Stoke Fears of Perverse ‘Incentive’ to Grab Americans
item.description: Hostile governments like Russia and Iran are often involved, and practical alternatives are hard to come by, experts say.

item.title: To Lam Confirmed as Vietnam’s Top Leader
item.description: Mr. Lam had been filling the post of general secretary temporarily since the death of his predecessor in July. Now he is in position to consolidate power.

item.title: Ken Griffin pledges $12 million to defeat recreational pot legalization in Florida
item.description: The founder of Citadel and Citadel Securities, who relocated from Chicago to Miami in 2022, has been wielding his $42 billion fortune to influence Florida’s political landscape and to fund philanthropic causes.
